TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit GCSettings extends System.Object
public ref class GCSettings abstract sealed

summary.span: Specifies the garbage collection settings for the current process.

span.span: Specifies the garbage collection settings for the current process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定是否为当前进程启用服务器垃圾回收。Use the property to determine whether server garbage collection is enabled for the current process.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property IsServerGC As Boolean
public: static property bool IsServerGC { bool get(); };

summary.span: Gets a value that indicates whether server garbage collection is enabled.

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether server garbage collection is enabled.

value.span: 如果启用了服务器垃圾回收，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if server garbage collection is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 有关服务器垃圾回收的信息，请参阅"工作站和服务器垃圾回收"一节中的[垃圾回收的基础](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/fundamentals.md)。For information about server garbage collection, see the "Workstation and Server Garbage Collection" section in [Fundamentals of Garbage Collection](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/fundamentals.md). 如果未启用服务器垃圾回收，工作站垃圾回收实际上是 （带有或不带并发回收）。If server garbage collection is not enabled, workstation garbage collection is in effect (with or without concurrent collection). 服务器垃圾回收是仅在多处理器计算机上可用。Server garbage collection is available only on multiprocessor computers. 非托管的宿主可以请求服务器垃圾回收，而主机请求覆盖配置文件设置。An unmanaged host can request server garbage collection, and the host request overrides configuration file settings. 如果主机未指定垃圾回收的类型，你可以使用配置文件设置来指定服务器垃圾回收。If the host does not specify the type of garbage collection, you can use a configuration file setting to specify server garbage collection. 此设置仅在应用程序配置文件中，不在计算机配置文件是否有效 (请参阅[配置应用](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/86bd26d3-737e-4484-9782-19b17f34cd1f))。This setting is valid only in the application configuration file, not in the machine configuration file (see [Configuring Apps](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/86bd26d3-737e-4484-9782-19b17f34cd1f)). 在以下示例启用服务器垃圾回收的示例应用程序配置文件的内容。The following example shows the contents of a sample application configuration file that enables server garbage collection. ``` ``` ## Examples 下面的示例指示主机计算机是否正在使用服务器或工作站垃圾回收。The following example indicates whether the host computer is using server or workstation garbage collection. [!code-csharp[Environment.IsServerGC#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/environment.IsServerGC/CS/isg.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Environment.IsServerGC#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/environment.IsServerGC/VB/isg.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Property LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode As GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode

public: static property System::Runtime::GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode { System::Runtime::GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode get(); void set(System::Runtime::GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode value); };

summary.span: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a full blocking garbage collection compacts the large object heap (LOH).

span.span: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a full blocking garbage collection compacts the large object heap (LOH).

value.span: 指示完全阻止垃圾回收是否压缩 LOH 的枚举值之一。

span.span: One of the enumeration values that indicates whether a full blocking garbage collection compacts the LOH.

remarks.format: ## Remarks LOH 用于分配需要多个 85,000 字节的大型对象 （如数组） 的内存。The LOH is used for allocating memory for large objects (such as arrays) that require more than 85,000 bytes. 由于复制较大的内存块的性能影响，垃圾回收器通常扫描 LOH，涉及到创建的已由死对象占用和可重用以满足将来请求的内存位置的列表大型对象的内存分配。Because of the performance impact of copying large blocks of memory, the garbage collector ordinarily sweeps the LOH, which involves creating a list of the memory locations that were occupied by dead objects and that can be reused to satisfy future requests for allocation of memory for large objects. 但是，广泛的应用中使用的 LOH 存储临时对象，内存碎片可能会也可能反过来会影响性能。However, in apps that make extensive use of the LOH to store transient objects, memory fragmentation can also adversely impact performance. 在这种情况下，它是可以使用属性而不是只需扫描 LOH 在过程中压缩垃圾回收。In this case, it is possible to use the property to compact rather than simply sweep the LOH during a garbage collection. 默认值属性是，指示在垃圾回收期间不会压缩 LOH。The default value of the property is , which indicates that the LOH is not compacted during garbage collections. 如果将属性分配值为、 期间下一步完全阻止垃圾回收，压缩 LOH 和属性值将重置为。If you assign the property a value of , the LOH is compacted during the next full blocking garbage collection, and the property value is reset to . > [!NOTE] > 未阻止后台垃圾回收。Background garbage collections are not blocking. 这意味着，如果你设置属性、 生成任何随后出现的 2 集合不压缩 LOH 的背景。This means that, if you set the property to , any background generation 2 collections that occur subsequently do not compact the LOH. 仅在第一个阻塞生成 2 回收压缩 LOH。Only the first blocking generation 2 collection compacts the LOH. 后属性设置为下, 一个完整的阻碍性垃圾回收 （和压缩 LOH） 发生在不确定的未来时间。After the property is set to , the next full blocking garbage collection (and compaction of the LOH) occurs at an indeterminate future time. 您可以立即压缩 LOH，通过使用代码如下所示：You can compact the LOH immediately by using code like the following: [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/cs/lohcompactionmode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/vb/lohcompactionmode1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Runtime.GCLatencyMode LatencyMode { get; set; }
Public Shared Property LatencyMode As GCLatencyMode
public: static property System::Runtime::GCLatencyMode LatencyMode { System::Runtime::GCLatencyMode get(); void set(System::Runtime::GCLatencyMode value); };
member this.LatencyMode : System.Runtime.GCLatencyMode with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets the current latency mode for garbage collection.

span.span: Gets or sets the current latency mode for garbage collection.

value.span: 指定滞后时间模式的枚举值之一。

span.span: One of the enumeration values that specifies the latency mode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你可以通过设置减少你的应用程序中垃圾回收的侵入性的级别到期间关键操作。You can reduce the level of intrusiveness of garbage collection in your application by setting the to during critical operations. 此类操作完成后，返回到更高的延迟模式，以便可以回收更多对象以增加内存。After such operations are completed, return to a higher latency mode so that more objects can be reclaimed to increase memory. 通常，你设置的值属性来定义垃圾回收器的滞后时间模式。Ordinarily, you set the value of the property to define the garbage collector's latency mode. 但是，不能通过将分配设置无 GC 区域延迟模式枚举值到属性。However, you cannot set the no GC region latency mode by assigning the enumeration value to the property. 而应调用方法，以开始无 GC 区域延迟模式，并且你调用结束它。Instead, you call the method to begin the no GC region latency mode, and you call the to end it. 请参阅[滞后时间模式](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/latency.md)有关垃圾回收的运行时配置设置如何影响的默认值的讨论枚举。See [Latency Modes](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/latency.md) for a discussion of how the runtime configuration settings for garbage collection affect the default value of the enumeration.

exception.span: The property is being set to an invalid value.

span.span: The property is being set to an invalid value.

exception.span: -or- The property cannot be set to .

span.span: -or- The property cannot be set to .

permission.span: 需要完全信任直接调用方。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 此成员不能由部分受信任或不透明的代码。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
